title: Calculate Q and compare to Kp

content.question:
<math alttext="H 2 O, gas, plus C O, gas, is in equilibrium with C O 2, gas, plus H 2, gas. K p equals 136 at 500 kelvin." overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>CO</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>â‡„</mo><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>136</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>at</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>500</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>

A vessel initially contains <math alttext="H 2 O, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> at a partial pressure of <math alttext="0.30 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.30</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>, <math alttext="C O, gas" overflow="scroll"><mi>CO</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> at a partial pressure of <math alttext="0.10 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>, <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> at a partial pressure of <math alttext="1.5 atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>, and <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> at a partial pressure of <math alttext="10, decimal point, atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math> at <math alttext="500 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>500</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>. Which of the following occurs as the system approaches equilibrium at <math alttext="500 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>500</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>?

choices.label: The partial pressures of <math alttext="H 2 O, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="C O, gas" overflow="scroll"><mi>CO</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> increase because <math alttext="Q is greater than K p" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math>.

The partial pressures of <math alttext="H 2 O, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="C O, gas" overflow="scroll"><mi>CO</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> increase because <math alttext="Q is less than K p" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math>.

The partial pressures of <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> increase because <math alttext="Q is greater than K p" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math>.

The partial pressures of <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> increase because <math alttext="Q is less than K p" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math>.

content.answer: The partial pressures of <math alttext="H 2 O, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="C O, gas" overflow="scroll"><mi>CO</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> increase because <math alttext="Q is greater than K p" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math>.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
